greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum T(n,k) of the entries in the k-th last cycles of all permutations of [n]; triangle T(n,k), n>=1, 1<=k<=n, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..20, flattened
example: T(3,2) = 10 because the sum of the entries in the second last cycles of all permutations of [3] ((123), (132), (12)(3), (13)(2), (1)(23), (1)(2)(3)) is 0+0+3+4+1+2 = 10.
xref: Main diagonal and first lower diagonal give: A000012, A002522.
Row sums give A000142 * A000217 = A180119.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, May 04 2017
